message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.DC 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper deals with a scenario of broadcasting content to a group of cooperating mobile devices over wireless broadcast links. It proposes a novel network coding scheme to improve content quality and completion time by exploiting device-to-device (D2D) connections. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper considers the problem of packet losses over wireless broadcast links and proposes a content and loss-aware network coding scheme to maximize the quality under the completion time constraint and minimize the completion time under the quality constraint. This involves information theoretic concepts such as channel coding and decoding. 
3. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper mentions video streaming as an application where not all packets have the same importance and not all devices are interested in the same quality of content. This suggests a multimedia context where different devices may have different requirements for content quality. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a scheme that jointly optimizes content quality and network coding opportunities by taking into account the importance of each packet towards the desired quality of service (QoS) as well as the channel losses over D2D links. This involves control and optimization of the network. 
5. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper deals with a scenario of broadcasting content to a group of cooperating mobile devices
